intro: Oldenburgia intermedia, commonly known as the Indian nettle or velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant has alternate, ovate leaves with a velvety texture and is often found in moist, disturbed habitats. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes. The plant is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
